titleStmt.title: Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.title: I. Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); name of the donor. A group of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I and II; the initial lines of some paragraphs and some passages within Text I; the initial two lines of each miracle in Text II; Trinitarian formula; some corrections (words or letters) interlineally and over erasures. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuation signs, of text dividers and quire marks; marginal notes.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 3ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ገድል፡ ወስምዕ᎓ ዘማር᎓ ወሕፃን᎓ ወሰማዕት፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዜና᎓ እሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ። ወዘካልአን᎓ ሂ፡ እልፍ፨ ወአሠርቱ᎓ ምእት᎓ ፵ወ፬ሰማዕት፡ እለ፡ ተከለሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እስክንድሮስ፡[sic] መኰንን። እስመ᎓ በመዋዕለ፡ ውእቱ᎓ መኰንን᎓ ኮነ፡ ዓቢይ᎓ ስደት᎓ ላዕለ᎓ አብያት᎓ ክርስቲያናት፡ ዘቂልቂያ፨… Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. Vita and martyrdom of the infant martyr mar Cyricus, and story of his mother Yulitta and of other 11,144 martyrs who were crowned during the time of the governor Alexander, because in the time of that governor there was a big persecution upon the churches of Cilicia.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 44va: …ወናሁ፡ ማር፡ ሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሀለወ፡ ወትረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይቀውም፡ በየማነ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፨ ወይተነብል፡ ምሕረተ፡ በእንቲአነ፡ ወበእንተ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ኃጥአን።Fol. 44va, l.1: …and behold, the infant mar Cyricus is always present standing on the right side of the living God, and he intercesses mercy for the sake of us and all the sinners.

listBibl.bibl: EMML no. 430 (1922/32), fols. 104r-112v: “Combat of St. Cyriacus [Gadla Qirqos]”
(EMML II, 150; Church of the Nativity, quarter of Lǝdäta, Addis Abäba).
(EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba).
EMML no. 1934 (late 19th or early 20th cent.), fols. 29r-46r: “Martyrdom [gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his Mother Julitta”
(EMML V, 420; Monastery of Ḥayq ʾƎsṭifanos, Ambassäl, Wällo).
EMML no. 2514 (1382/88), fols. 126r-133r (in the “Gädlä Samaʿtat”): “Martyrdom of Cyriacus and his mother, Julitta, [Qirqos wa-emmu Iyyaluṭā]"
(EMML VII, 10; Church of Astit Kidanä Mǝḥrät, Ankobärr, Shoa).
fols. 2r-20r: “Martyrdom [Gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta”;
fols. 42r-61v: “Martyrdom [Gadl wa-samāʿt] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta”
(EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yağğu, Wällo).
(EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wällo).
fol. 28: “Martyre de S. Cyr et sa mère Julitta et des onze mille trente-quatre autres martyrs qui suoffrirent du temps du Tribun Alexandre”
fols. 1ra-28vb: “Martyre de l`enfant Cyriaques (Qirqos) et sa mère Juliette (ʾIyalouṭâ)”
fol. 128r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (16th of Ṭӗr)”
fol. 200r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta (15th of Ṭӗr)”
fol. 84r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Martyrdom of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (15th of Ṭӗr)”
fols. 1r-109v: “The acts of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, ቂርቆስ፡, and Julitta, ኢየሉጣ”
fols. 218r-227r (“Gädlä Samaʿtat”): “ቂርቆስ፡ und seine Mutter ኢየሉጣ፡”
fols. 57ra-80vb “Vita und Zeugnis des hl. Kyriakos und seiner Mutter Julietta (äthiop.: Iyaluṭā)”

msItem.title: Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); name of the donor. A group of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I and II; the initial lines of some paragraphs and some passages within Text I; the initial two lines of each miracle in Text II; Trinitarian formula; some corrections (words or letters) interlineally and over erasures. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuation signs, of text dividers and quire marks; marginal notes.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 45ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ነዋ᎓ ጸሐፍነ᎓ ተአምራቲሁ᎓ ለሕፃን᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ ከመ᎓ ኢይኩን᎓ ዝንጋዔ᎓ ለእለ᎓ ይሰምዐ[sic]᎓ ሰማዕያን፨ ጸሎቱ᎓ ወበረከቱ᎓ ወረድኤተ᎓ ወላዲቱ᎓ የሃሉ᎓ ምስለ᎓ ገብሩ᎓ ዘመንፈስ᎓ ቅዱስ᎓ ለዓለመ᎓ ዓለም᎓ አሜን፨ ወሀሎ᎓ አሐዱ᎓ ንጉሥ᎓ ጻድቅ᎓ ወካህን᎓ ዘተወክፈ᎓ ሢመተ᎓ ክህነት᎓ እምአፈ᎓ አምላኩ᎓ በሀገረ᎓ ሮሀ᎓ ቅድስት፨…Fol. 45ra: (Introduction) In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. Behold, we wrote the miracles of the infant Cyricus in order that it would not be senselessness to the auditors who listen. May his prayer and his blessing and the help of his mother be with his servant Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus. For the eternity, amen. (Miracle 1) And there was a righteous king and priest who received the ordination from the mouth of his God in the saint region of Roha.…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 71va, l.10: (Miracle 12) …ሕፃን᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ ባሕቱ᎓ ከመ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ፈቀደ፨ ለእለ᎓ ፀንሕዎ᎓ ሕዝብ᎓ በተስፋ᎓ ዕበየ᎓ ኃይሉ᎓ አግሀደ፨ ወሰገራተ᎓ እምቤቱ᎓ ሰደደ፨Fol. 71va, l.10: (Miracle 12) … But the infant Cyricus, as he wished, revealed the magnificence of his power to the people who observed him with hope, and he expelled the guards from his house.

listBibl.bibl: (EMML II, 4; Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, Addis Abäba).
(EMML II, 364; Church of St. Cyriacus [Qirqos], quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba).
(EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yağğu, Wallo).
(EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wallo).

note.p: II-1) St. Cyricus and King in the region of “Roha” (fols. 45ra-46rb) (በስመ፡ʼʼ… ነዋ᎓ ጸሐፍነ᎓ ተአምራቲሁ᎓ ለሕፃን᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ … ወሀሎ᎓ አሐዱ᎓ ንጉሥ᎓ ጻድቅ᎓ ወካህን᎓ ዘተወክፈ᎓ ሢመተ᎓ ክህነት᎓ እምአፈ᎓ አምላኩ᎓ በሀገረ᎓ ሮሀ᎓ ቅድስት፨ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 59v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 28vb-30rb, GrébGriaule II, 4. The same miracle as inUM-008, fols. 23ra-24rb, in which the name of the king is Yǝmrǝḥannä Krǝstos; the same miracle is inUM-009, fols. 84rb-84vb, and in AMQ-007, fols. 136rb-137rb, where instead of "Roha" it is written "Rome").
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fols. 47rb-47va) (በደመ፡ ስምዑ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ ለአርዌ፡ ሰማይ፡ ንማዖ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሶበ፡ ንጼውዖ። እንዘ፡ ትብል፡ ተካየድከ፡ አልፋ፡ ወኦ፨…).
II-2) St. Cyricus and the monk from a remote region (fols. 47va–50va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ጸሎተ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ምስኪን፡ ወነዳይ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ ብሔር፨ ወይትመሐፀኑ፡ በኪዳኑ፡ ክብርት፡ ወይትአመን፡…)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 85-86, 88-89 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 60v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 30rb-31vb, GrébGriaule II, 4-5. Cp. alsoUM-009, fols. 85ra-85va).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 50va) (ሰላም፡ ለሕማምከ፡ ወለግፍዕከ፡ ብዙኅ፨ እንተ፡ ያብኪ፡…).

II-3) St. Cyricus and the sterile couple who was supplicating to the saint for getting a baby (fols. 50va-52rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይትአመኖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወያፈቅር፡ ጾመ፡ ወጸሎተ፨ ወብእሲቱ፡ መካን፡ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 86-87, 89-90 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 61v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 31vb-32vb, GrébGriaule II, 5. Cp.UM-009, fols. 85va-85vb).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 52rb) (ሰላም፡ ለህላዌከ፡ ማእከለ፡ ሰብዓቱ፡ ነገድ፨ እለ፡…).
II-4) St. Cyricus and the monk ʾElyas (fols. 52rb-55rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ ፩መነኮስ፡ በዛቲ፡ ደሴተ፡ ፃና፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤልያስ፨ ዘይትለአከ፡ ወትረ፡ በመዓልት፡ ወበሌሊት፡ በትጋህ፡ ዘእንበሰ፡ ጽርዓት፡ ለታቦተ፡ ሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un noveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 87-91 // Mss. EMML no. 3469, fol. 22r, EMML VIII, 283; EMML no. 4816, fol. 62v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 32vb-33vb, GrébGriaule II, 5. Cp. alsoUM-009, fols. 85vb-86rb, andUM-008, fols. 35ra-36ra).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fols. 55rb-55va) (እግዚኣብሔር፡ ሤመ፡ ረድኤቶ፡ ለንስዕናከ፡ ዓቃቤ፨ ወስምዖ፡…).

II-5) St. Cyricus and the poor woman who was selling the water (fols. 55va-57ra) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወነበረት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ ወትሠይጥ፡ ማየ፡ ለሲሳየ፡ ዕለት፨ ወባቲ፡ ለይእት፡ ብእሲት፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ፡ ንዑሰ፡ አካል፡ ዘሠለስቱ፡ ዓመት፡ ወመንፈቀ፡ ዓመት፨…).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 57ra-b) (ሰላም፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ እንተ፡ ኢፈርሆ፡ ለነድ፨ ዘይሰማዕ፡ ድምፁ፡ ከመ፡ ነጐድጓ፨…).

II-6) St. Cyricus and the son of a presbyter of the church devoted to him (fols. 57rb-59va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወነበረ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአቡሁ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘይትለአክ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወድንግል፡ በ፪ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ወልድ፡ አቡሁ፡ ...).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 59va) (አመ፡ ተመከሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ በደዌ፡ መከራት፡ ክልኤ፨ ወተስፋ፡ ድኂን፡ ቀብፁ፡ መንገለ፡ ኃጥኡ፡ ረዳኤ፨…).
II-7) St. Cyricus and the governor in front of the King (fols. 59vb-62rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወኮነ፡ በ፩ዕለት፡ እመዋዕል፡ አስሮሙ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ቅድመ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ለመንፈቀ፡ ካህናቲሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ መስተጋድል፡ በግፍዕ፡ በሐስት፨ ...).
II-8) St. Cyricus and the woman who had no husband (fols. 62rb-64vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀለወት፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐቲ፡ በእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ወመበለት፡ ይእቲ፡ ወትመከረት፡ በደዌ፡…)
(cp. Ms.UM-009, fols. 80vb-81ra).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fols. 64vb-65ra) (ኢተሐልዩ፡ ዘትብሉ፡ ወዘት ነብቡ፡ ከመ፡ ለቀደምት፡ ተጽሕፈ፨ እስመ፡ ዮም፡ ለክሙ፡…).
II-9) St. Cyricus and the great ruler who was imprisoned (fols. 65ra-66rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ ፩መስፍን፡ ዓቢይ፡ ዘተወድየ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ሞቅሕ፡ በትእዛዘ፡ ንጉሥ፡ እስመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መስፍን፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወልደ፡ እሳቱ፡ ውእቱ፨...).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 66va) (ለመስፍን፡ ሙቁሕ፡ ብሥራተ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንዋም፨ ከመ፡ አብሰርኮ፡ በሕልም፨…).

II-10) St. Cyricus and the strong wind from the west that destroyed the church devoted to him (fols. 66va-67vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … መጽአ፡ ዓቢይ፡ ነፋስ፡ በጊዜ፡ ስድስቱ፡ ሰዓተ፡ መዓልት፡ እመንገለ፡ ዓረብ፡ ወነሥአ፡ ተድባበ፡ ቤቱ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡…).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 67vb) (አስፍንቱ፡ አብያተ፡ ውቅሮ፡ እለ፡ ወድቁ፡ ወተመዝበሩ፨ ኀበ፡ ተዳደቆሙ፡…).
II-11) St. Cyricus and the sick man (fols. 68ra-69rb) (ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ክቡር፡ ወልዑል፡ ወበስነ፡ ሀብቱ፡ ጽሒፈ፡ ተአምራቲሁ፡ ወመንክቲሁ፡ ለሐፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ቅድስት፡ … ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሕሙም፡ ዘኢይክል፡ ቀዊመ፡ ወየዓቅብ፡ …)
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 69va) (አመ፡ ተመከሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ በደዌ፡ መክራት፡ ክልኤ፨ ወተስፋ፡ ድኂን፡ ቀብጹ፡ መንገለ፡ ኃጥኤ፨…).
II-12) St. Cyricus and the pagans who waged a war against Christians (fols. 69va-71va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … በአሐዱ፡ ዓመት፡ እምአዝማነ፡ መከራ፨ አመ፡ ኮነ፡ ድልቅልቅ፡ በበብሔሩ፡ እስመ፡ ጠፍአ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ራትዕ፡ ...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 90ra-91rb).
The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 71va) (መኑ፡ እምክህለ፡ አድኅኖ፡ እምእለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ልማደ፨ ፍና፡ ሰርከ፡…).

msItem.note: - In Text II, the miracles are not numbered.

msItem.colophon: Fol. 44va l.7: ወናሁ፡ በዝየ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ገድሉ፡ ወስምዑ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ አምላካዊ፨ በረከተ፡ ጸሎቱ፨ ወሀብተ፡ ረድኤቱ፡ ወረድኤተ፡ ወላዲቱ፨ የሃሉ፡ [fol. 44vb] ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ዘመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፨ ለይኩን፡Fol. 44va l.7: Herewith, the book of the life and martyrdom of the infant Cyricus, divine martyr, has been completed. May the blessing of his prayer and the gift of his help and the help of his mother be with his servant Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus. For the eternity, amen and amen. Let it be. The colophon is followed by a short hymn (sälam lä-mälkǝʿka mälkǝʿa mädängäṣ mäläkot...); s. fol. 44vb, ls. 4-13.

supportDesc.extent: Made of 72.0 folios, of which blank 1r-2v, 71vb, 72r-v, in 10.0 quires ((A + 9)). 27.0 22.0 4.5

signatures.note: - Undecorated quire marks are written thrice in the upper margin (partly in the main hand, partly in a secondary hand) in fols.: 3r: ፩; 11r: ፬; 19r: ፪; 27r: ፫; 35r: ፭; 43r: ፮; 51r: ፯; fol. 59r: ፰; 67r: ፱.

list.item: 6 2 ፱IX(6/fols. 67r-72v). Quires 2, 3 and 4 are misplaced; according to the text and to the quires marks, the correct sequence would be: A(2)

supportDesc.condition: Quires 2, 3 and 4 are misplaced, possibly as a result of resewing.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling (below on fol. 9r-v).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
A bottom ruled line has not been used by the scribe on fols. 52r-v, 57v, 69v-71r.

list.item: nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
four nine dot asterisks (esp. fols.: 59va, l.16);
more nine asterisks with, below, chain of black and red dots (esp. fol. 12vab, l.7);
chain of black dots (esp. fol. 41va, l.8).

handDesc.handNote: Distinctive features: conspicuously right-sloping letters, thick vertical stokes.

list.item: Fol. 2v: Donation note. Fol. 2v: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘደጅ፡ አዝማች፡ ሰባ፡ ጋዲስ፡ መኰንነ፡ መኳንንት፡ መስፍነ፡ መሳፍንት፡ {ዘ}ወሀቦ፡ ለመቅደሰ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ዘአድ፡ ገራት፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ ለመድኃኒተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ አሜን። Fol. 2v: This (is) the book of däğğazmač Säba Gadis, the governor of the governors and the prince of the princes, which he gave to the sanctuary of St. Cyricus of ʾAdd Grat, so that it might be the remedy for the flesh and soul. Amen.

- The title ገድለ ቂርቆስ is written on fol. 1r in red ink and in pen. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: fols. 3ra, 8ra, 18rb, 27rb, 39rb, 66ra. - Erasures: fols. 14rb, 24rb. - Erasures marked by parallel lines over the word: fols. 14va, 22rb, 48rb, 49vb, 58rb. - Immediate corrections written over erasures on fol. 3rb. - Space left unfilled for the rubricated name of Qirqos on fol. 65rb. - Crude notes in pen or in pencil in the upper margin of fols: 64r and 69v and on fol. 72v. - Lacunae: fols. 24vb, ls. 1-2, 37rb, ls. 12-14.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: cross hatching, double circle, triple line fillet, criss cross, double sine wave with dots, double crescent).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus (the baptismal name of däğğazmač Säba Gadis or Säbagadis, b. 1780/85, d. 1831; s. EAE IV, 430-31) is mentioned in the colophon, in Additio 1 and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. (e.g. fols. 45ra, 47rb).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
